data.actual_result: The emoji is converted to the internal name-id representation upon sending but since it's inside a code block it's not rendered as an emoji but as raw text, resulting in it appearing as \<:test:395628907224629248\> for everyone
data.expected_result: Just like in the Desktop app the content inside a code block should be sent as it is and not modified, meaning the emoji should appear as :test: inside the code block
data.short_description: When putting a valid custom emoji inside a code block it will be converted into the internal <:name:id> representation upon sending
data.steps_to_repro: - Create a code block with backticks (either inline or block) - Put a custom emoji that you have access to inside it (because it's in the same server or you have Nitro), like \`:test:\` - Send message and observe
